articles.headline: As Oil Spill Trial Opens, Push for a Deal Continues
articles.snippet: Opening arguments cataloged BP’s failures in the 2010 disaster, but negotiators were said to be working on multibillion-dollar settlement.
articles.abstract: Opening arguments cataloged BP’s failures in the 2010 disaster, but negotiators were said to be working on multibillion-dollar settlement.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — BP finally faced off in court Monday against an army of federal and state prosecutors, lawyers and even its contract partners over the Gulf of Mexico oil spill three years ago, contending that it alone should not shoulder blame for the rig explosion that killed 11 workers and soiled beaches and marshes from Louisiana to Florida.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Barry Meier

articles.headline: How Will Magazine Titans Merge? Carefully
articles.snippet: Time Inc. and Meredith, whose corporate cultures have already proved sharply discordant once, are creating a new company to house many of their magazines.
articles.abstract: Time Inc. and Meredith, whose corporate cultures have already proved sharply discordant once, are creating a new company to house many of their magazines.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Jack Griffin, the former president of the magazine company Meredith, took the reins at Time Inc., he threw a holiday party for his staff on the 34th floor of the Time & Life Building. For many employees at the famously hierarchal company, their first visit to the rambling executive suites that inspired the sets of “Mad Men” became known as “The Miracle on 34th.”

articles.headline: Treasury Pick Tries to Cast His History as Right for the Job
articles.snippet: Jacob Lew, who faces a Senate panel on Tuesday, is expected to be confirmed as Treasury secretary despite questions about his finances and payment for past work.
articles.abstract: Jacob Lew, who faces a Senate panel on Tuesday, is expected to be confirmed as Treasury secretary despite questions about his finances and payment for past work.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the Senate gears up to vote on the next Treasury secretary, President Obama’s choice for the job, Jacob J. Lew, has been forced to navigate through something of a political minefield.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Annie Lowrey

articles.headline: U.S. Exposure to Horse Meat: Answers to Common Questions
articles.snippet: The Department of Agriculture says the United States imports no beef from any of the European countries where horse meat mixed with beef has been found.
articles.abstract: The Department of Agriculture says the United States imports no beef from any of the European countries where horse meat mixed with beef has been found.
articles.lead_paragraph: The alarm in Europe over the discovery of horse meat in beef products escalated again Monday, when the Swedish furniture giant Ikea withdrew an estimated 1,670 pounds of meatballs from sale in 14 European countries.

articles.headline: Low Pay at Weight Watchers Stirs Protest as Stars Rake It In
articles.snippet: Hundreds of the leading weight-loss company’s rank-and-file workers are waging an open rebellion that has management scrambling to improve working conditions.
articles.abstract: Hundreds of the leading weight-loss company’s rank-and-file workers are waging an open rebellion that has management scrambling to improve working conditions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tammy Williams became a Weight Watchers leader in Texas five years ago after losing 97 pounds in the program. The supplies that she handles fill a bedroom in her home, and she holds four meetings a week advising more than a hundred customers about the diet regimen.

articles.headline: Banks Fear Court Ruling in Argentina Bond Debt
articles.snippet: An appeals court ruling on a case between the government of Argentina and hedge funds and other investors could have a major effect on world debt markets.
articles.abstract: An appeals court ruling on a case between the government of Argentina and hedge funds and other investors could have a major effect on world debt markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: A fierce battle between the government of Argentina and investors led by a group of hedge funds has already led to the seizure of a naval ship and dragged in the United States Treasury. Now a federal appeals court is hearing the dispute, and how it rules could have a major impact on world debt markets.

articles.headline: Saudis Step Up Help for Rebels in Syria With Croatian Arms
articles.snippet: Weapons that Western officials say were bought by Saudi Arabia and funneled to opposition fighters in Syria have been a factor in the rebels’ small tactical gains this winter against President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.abstract: Weapons that Western officials say were bought by Saudi Arabia and funneled to opposition fighters in Syria have been a factor in the rebels’ small tactical gains this winter against President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia has financed a large purchase of infantry weapons from Croatia and quietly funneled them to antigovernment fighters in Syria in a drive to break the bloody stalemate that has allowed President Bashar al-Assad to cling to power, according to American and Western officials familiar with the purchases.
articles.byline: By C. J. Chivers and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: ‘Shareholder Democracy’ Can Mask Abuses
articles.snippet: It increasingly appears that the rise of “shareholder democracy” is leading, in some cases, to a perverse game.
articles.abstract: It increasingly appears that the rise of “shareholder democracy” is leading, in some cases, to a perverse game.
articles.lead_paragraph: Martin Lipton, one of the nation’s top corporate lawyers, was dismayed.

articles.headline: Yahoo Orders Home Workers Back to the Office
articles.snippet: The Internet pioneer takes on one of the country’s biggest workplace issues in the hope of fostering more innovation.
articles.abstract: The Internet pioneer takes on one of the country’s biggest workplace issues in the hope of fostering more innovation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since Marissa Mayer became chief executive of Yahoo, she has been working hard to get the Internet pioneer off its deathbed and make it an innovator once again.
articles.byline: By Claire Cain Miller and Catherine Rampell

articles.headline: Republicans Sign Brief in Support of Gay Marriage
articles.snippet: Dozens of prominent Republicans signed an amicus brief that will be submitted to the Supreme Court ahead of arguments in two cases next month.
articles.abstract: Dozens of prominent Republicans signed an amicus brief that will be submitted to the Supreme Court ahead of arguments in two cases next month.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Dozens of prominent Republicans — including top advisers to former President George W. Bush, four former governors and two members of Congress — have signed a legal brief arguing that gay people have a constitutional right to marry, a position that amounts to a direct challenge to Speaker John A. Boehner and reflects the civil war in the party since the November election.

articles.headline: Fed Defends Stimulus in Testimony to Senate
articles.snippet: Ben S. Bernanke told senators that the central bank saw its campaign as necessary and effective, reassuring them that its benefits outweighed any risks.
articles.abstract: Ben S. Bernanke told senators that the central bank saw its campaign as necessary and effective, reassuring them that its benefits outweighed any risks.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, played down concerns about the Fed’s economic stimulus campaign on Tuesday, describing it as necessary and effective and making clear it was likely to continue for some time.
